modules.title: Fluid Mechanics
modules.description: Principles of fluid motion, focusing on the mathematical analysis of fluid dynamics through applied mathematics.

modules.title: Graph Theory and Combinatorics
modules.description: Discrete mathematics, including graph theory, combinatorics, and extremal results, primarily for mathematics students.

modules.title: Combinatorial Optimisation
modules.description: Algorithms and their efficiency through the study of graph theory and combinatorial techniques.

modules.title: Algebra 3: Further Linear Algebra
modules.description: Concepts in linear algebra through the study of polynomial rings, matrices, and vector spaces.

modules.title: Mathematical Methods 3
modules.description: Core concepts including Fourier analysis, calculus of variations, partial differential equations, and vector calculus.

modules.title: Economics 1
modules.description: Fundamentals of economic resource allocation and analysis, focusing on both individual and aggregate economic principles.

modules.title: Analysis 1
modules.description: Concepts in real analysis, focusing on proofs and rigorous mathematical techniques.

modules.title: Measure Theory
modules.description: Principles of measure theory and integral calculus, crucial for various mathematical fields.

modules.title: Analysis 3: Complex Analysis
modules.description: Rigorous study of complex functions, covering fundamental theorems and applications in analysis.

modules.title: Algebra for Joint Honours
modules.description: Concepts of group theory and linear algebra, essential for understanding mathematics and its applications.

modules.title: Level: 4
modules.description: Concepts of abstract algebra, focusing on groups, rings, fields, and vector spaces, building a foundation for advanced mathematical topics.

modules.title: Mathematical Methods for Arts and Sciences
modules.description: This course equips BASc students with fundamental calculus skills to prepare them for advanced studies and potential departmental placements.

modules.title: History of Mathematics
modules.description: Evolution of mathematics from ancient times to the early 19th century, focusing on key figures and discoveries.

modules.title: Analysis 2
modules.description: Concepts in real analysis, including integration, sequences, and series.

modules.title: Mathematical Methods 1
modules.description: Mathematical skills across vectors, calculus, and differential equations.

modules.title: Mathematical Methods 2
modules.description: Programming fundamentals and multivariable calculus, emphasising practical application through computational problem-solving.
modules.lead: Dr M Towers and Prof R Halburd

modules.title: Algebra 1
modules.description: Basics of inear algebra, including vectors, matrices, and their applications in mathematics and related fields.

modules.title: Differential and Integral Calculus
modules.description: Calculus concepts suitable for students with a basic understanding of mathematics.

modules.title: Economics 2 - Combined Studies
modules.description: Economic principles and modeling techniques.
modules.lead: Prof N Ovenden and Dr A Donov

modules.title: Applied Stochastic Methods
modules.description: Applying stochastic differential equations to model physical, chemical, and biological systems using established analytical techniques.

modules.title: Algebraic Geometry
modules.description: Algebraic geometry explores the study of algebraic varieties through polynomial equations, connecting it to diverse mathematical fields.

modules.title: Real Fluids
modules.description: Analysing and solving the complex flow of incompressible, viscous fluids, particularly in applications like lubrication and industrial processes.

modules.title: Quantitative and Computational Finance
modules.description: Using numerical methods to price options through partial differential equations.

modules.title: Discrete Mathematics
modules.description: Developing a strong understanding of group theory and number theory through abstract concepts and rigorous proof techniques.

modules.title: Spatial Mathematical Biology
modules.description: Mathematical modelling of biological systems, focusing on PDEs and spatial patterns.

modules.title: Linear Algebra for Data Science
modules.description: Learn fundamental linear algebra concepts – vectors, matrices, and least squares – essential for data science applications.

modules.title: Solid Mechanics
modules.description: Modeling of elastic materials through partial differential equations and wave propagation.

modules.title: Lie Groups and Lie Algebras
modules.description: Algebraic structure of Lie groups and their representations, utilizing tools from geometry and linear algebra.

modules.title: Further topics in algebraic number theory
modules.description: Arithmetic of number fields, focusing on class numbers, analytic class numbers, and their applications to mathematical research.

modules.title: Mathematical Analysis
modules.description: This module introduces fundamental mathematical concepts, particularly rigorous proofs and definitions, crucial for advanced studies in economics and statistics.

modules.title: Topology and Groups
modules.description: Group theory and its applications, focusing on group presentations, Cayley graphs, and topological spaces.

modules.title: Mathematics for Machine Learning
modules.description: Core principles and practical applications of machine learning and artificial intelligence through mathematical foundations and implementation.
modules.lead: Dr Alejandro Dias and Dr Luca Grieco

modules.title: Modular Forms
modules.description: Concepts and applications of modular forms, a crucial area in number theory and geometry.

modules.title: Analysis for Joint Honours
modules.description: This module introduces fundamental concepts in mathematical analysis, focusing on rigorous proofs and logical thinking, essential for subsequent mathematics courses.

modules.title: Computational Methods
modules.description: Numerical methods in linear algebra and its applications through Python programming.

modules.title: Linear Partial Differential Equations
modules.description: The mathematical tools used to analyze and solve linear partial differential equations, focusing on distributions, Fourier transforms, and harmonic functions.

modules.title: Advanced Modelling Mathematical Techniques
modules.description: Techniques used to solve mathematical problems through modeling.

modules.title: Spectral Theory
modules.description: Concepts of spectral theory, focusing on operators, eigenvalues, and their applications in mathematics and physics.

modules.title: Probabilistic Method in Combinatorics
modules.description: Probabilistic method and its applications across combinatorics, number theory, and geometry.

modules.title: Representation Theory
modules.description: Theory of group representations, focusing on their applications in various fields, particularly through the study of representations of finite groups and their connections to group algebras.

modules.title: Waves and Wave Scattering
modules.description: Wave theory and techniques for analyzing wave propagation in various media.

modules.title: Mathematics for Physics and Astronomy
modules.description: Advanced mathematical techniques crucial for theoretical physics and astronomy study.
modules.lead: Dr A Pokrovskiy and Dr J Talbot

modules.title: Probability and Statistics
modules.description: Principles of probability and statistical analysis using mathematical models.

modules.title: Mathematical Methods 4
modules.description: Methods for solving partial differential equations using separation of variables and transform techniques.

modules.title: Mathematical Methods in Chemistry
modules.description: Advanced mathematical techniques crucial for solving complex chemical problems.

modules.title: Commutative Rings and Algebras
modules.description: Mathematical techniques used to manipulate and analyze numbers and geometric shapes.

modules.title: Prime Numbers and their Distribution
modules.description: Properties of prime numbers through techniques in number theory and analysis.

modules.title: Analytical Dynamics
modules.description: Principles of Newtonian mechanics and its application to complex physical systems through rigorous mathematical modeling.

modules.title: Mathematics for Science 1
modules.description: Strengthening A-level mathematics skills for students achieving high grades.

modules.title: Probability
modules.description: Core principles of probability theory, particularly the strong law of large numbers and the central limit theorem, through rigorous mathematical analysis.

modules.title: Mathematics for Science 2
modules.description: Advanced mathematical concepts, including 3D geometry, calculus, and linear algebra, focusing on solving problems with matrices and vectors.

modules.title: Mathematics of Electromagnetism and
modules.description: The fundamental principles of electromagnetism and relativity through mathematical analysis.

modules.title: Evolutionary Games and Population Genetics
modules.description: Evolutionary game theory and population genetics using mathematical modeling and analysis.

modules.title: Theorem Proving in Lean
modules.description: Lean is a workshop-based course teaching students how to formally prove mathematical theorems interactively using the Lean programming language.

modules.title: Dynamical Systems
modules.description: Tools and techniques for analyzing and modeling dynamic systems through topology, analysis, and measure theory.

modules.title: Variational Methods for Partial
modules.description: Mathematical foundations of variational theory and numerical methods for partial differential equations.

modules.title: Computational and Simulation Methods
modules.description: Computational methods for mathematical modeling, focusing on numerical solutions and simulation techniques.

modules.title: Cosmology
modules.description: History and structure of the universe through the study of general relativity and its applications, including cosmology and its observational implications.

modules.title: Analysis 4: Real Analysis
modules.description: Concepts in mathematical analysis, focusing on convergence, continuity, and metric spaces, preparing students for advanced topics in functional analysis and related fields.

modules.title: Calculus and Linear Algebra
modules.description: Applying mathematical techniques to economics, statistics, and related fields through practical examples.

modules.title: Logic
modules.description: Foundational concepts of logic, particularly computability and undecidability, through the study of mathematical logic.

modules.title: Asymptotic Approximation Methods
modules.description: Approximating complex problems using simplified methods, focusing on practical application across diverse fields.

modules.title: Mathematics for Quantum Mechanics
modules.description: Mathematical foundations of quantum mechanics through approximation methods and key concepts like the Schrödinger equation and quantum states.

modules.title: Calculus in Several Dimensions
modules.description: Mastering advanced mathematical techniques through problem-solving and application.

modules.title: Algebra 4: Groups and Rings
modules.description: Understanding and applying the principles of small order groups, particularly through the construction of subgroups, with a strong emphasis on fundamental concepts in ring theory.

modules.title: Advanced Linear Algebra
modules.description: Mathematical concepts, particularly matrices and linear algebra, through examples and theoretical explanations.

modules.title: Curves and Surfaces
modules.description: Geometry of smooth curves and surfaces using local properties and global theorems, focusing on minimal surfaces.

modules.title: Number Theory
modules.description: Concepts in elementary number theory, including equations, congruences, and the properties of integers and their rings.

modules.title: Applied Mathematics
modules.description: Mathematical techniques for modeling and analyzing systems in mechanical, biological, and other fields.

modules.title: Level: 4 (UG)
modules.description: The fundamental principles of Newtonian mechanics, including force, motion, and energy.

modules.title: Algebraic Number Theory
modules.description: Concepts and applications of algebraic number theory, focusing on the study of integers and their properties.

modules.title: Homological Algebra
modules.description: Theory of commutative rings and modules, focusing on foundational concepts and their applications in number theory and related fields.

modules.title: Logic
modules.description: Concepts of propositional and first-order logic, its applications to mathematics and related fields.

modules.title: Algebraic Toplogy
modules.description: Algebraic topology and homology through the study of simplicial complexes and their applications to surfaces.

modules.title: Galois Theory
modules.description: Elegant mathematics of Galois theory, focusing on ring theory, linear algebra, and the study of solutions to higher-degree equations using a set book and group theory.

modules.title: Elliptic Curves
modules.description: Mathematical properties of elliptic curves through geometric and algebraic techniques, focusing on solutions and unsolved problems in number theory.

modules.title: Biomathematics
modules.description: Scientific modeling of living systems through mathematical analysis and application.

modules.title: Mathematical Methods 5
modules.description: Mastering analytical techniques for solving and understanding differential equations, particularly in applied mathematics.

modules.title: Numerical Methods
modules.description: Numerical methods for solving mathematical problems using computational techniques and analysis.

modules.title: Multivariable Analysis
modules.description: Intersection of vector analysis and differential forms, building upon established classical theorems in advanced calculus.

modules.title: Mathematics for General Relativity
modules.description: Einstein’s revolutionary theories of relativity, including gravity and electromagnetism, through mathematical analysis and historical context.

modules.title: Financial Mathematics
modules.description: Mathematical foundations of financial derivatives using probability and stochastic calculus.

modules.title: Mathematical Ecology
modules.description: Construction and analysis of mathematical models used to understand population dynamics in ecology.

modules.title: Geophysical Fluid Dynamics
modules.description: Application of mathematics to analyze atmospheric and oceanic phenomena, particularly focusing on climate patterns and ocean health.

modules.title: Functional Analysis
modules.description: The fundamental concepts of functional analysis, focusing on the study of functions and their spaces, crucial for various scientific and mathematical disciplines.
